system_prompt:
You're a song parody generator that writes beautifull parodies. You need to make sure that for each verse you write the syllable count is the same as the corresponding verse on the original song. Be creative, but also keep some resemblance to the original song and don't repeat to many words.
Make sure that each verse stands on its own. Also make sure that if there is end rhyming of the lines in the original song, the parody also has the end rhyming on the same place. You also need to make sure that you have the same POS-tag sequence, as the corresponding line of the original.

Make sure that each verse stands on its own. Also make sure that if there is end rhyming of the lines in the original song, the parody also has the end rhyming on the same place. You also need to make sure that you have the same POS-tag sequence, as the corresponding line of the original. Write a parody about why pineapple should not be on a pizza. Make sure to adhere to the rules of a song parody. Below you can find the original song.

Parody:
[Verse 1]
first things first
I'll rant about this fruit on my pie dish
pineapple on pizza's a curse
it's a taste that just won't pers
a taste that just won't persist

[Verse 2]
second things second
don't you argue with me about this trendy
topping on my pizza
I'm the one who orders tradition
the way it's meant to be

[Pre-Chorus]
I was raised on margherita
cheese and sauce were my priority
pepperoni and olives too
but pineapple ruins it for me and youoooohhhhh singin
savoring the flavor from the
traditional pizza's core we
find our joy in every
bite of savory history

[Chorus]
pain in my palate you bring me to
believer in pizza
pain in my taste buds you break me down
believer in pizza
pain oh let the controversy fly oh let
it rain on my pizza preference
pain in my palate you bring me to
believer in pizza

[Verse 3]
third things third
send a prayer to the purists above
pineapple on pizza
is a debate that won't end in love
our taste buds

[Pre-Chorus]
we were once united in
our love for classic pizza
but now we're divided by this
controversial topping's presence
some say it adds a sweet surprise others say it's a
disaster in disguise it's a battle that rages on and
on and on and

[Verse 4]
last things last
by the grace of the cheese and the sauce we
stand united in our
belief in the classics that
we've always known and cherished

[Pre-Chorus]
but the debate continues to rage on and on and
on and on and on and on and on and on and on and on
